meanings.definition: Unable to be endured or tolerated.
meanings.sent1: The heat in the room was insupportable for the little puppy.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise was insupportable for the baby's sensitive ears.
meanings.sent3: The insupportable tickling made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world felt insupportable on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The insupportable pain in her tooth made her rush to the dentist.

meanings.definition: Not able to be supported or justified.
meanings.sent1: The insupportable decision left everyone confused and upset.
meanings.sent2: The insupportable theory lacked evidence to back it up.
meanings.sent3: The insupportable excuse made everyone roll their eyes.
meanings.sent4: The insupportable argument crumbled under scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The insupportable claim was quickly dismissed by experts.
